numbered_ace_sentences: 1. The graph compares two age groups.
2. One age group is 15-24 years old.
3. One age group is 40 years old or older.
4. The graph compares whether people think that the world is becoming better.
5. People who are 15-24 years old are more optimistic than people who are 40 years old or older.
6. I wonder whether the graph is inaccurate.
7. I think that young people cannot really understand how the world was in the past.
9. Because the world changes very fast, it is hard to determine whether the world is becoming better.
10. A person can know major historical events.
11. If a person did not live through a time, then the person cannot really know that time.
12. I wonder whether young people are more optimistic because they were raised with the internet.
13. The internet can give young people more hope.
14. The internet can give young people more belief that the world will become better.
15. I ask whether more young people think that the world is becoming better because of the economic situation in their country.
16. I wonder how the graph would look if the survey asked people who are 40 years old or older about their opinions when they were younger.
17. I wonder whether the answers of these people would differ.
18. The catch phrase is: Countries Optimistic Generation.
